thread.title: Damien Chazelle wins best director for 'La La Land' - LA Times
thread.title_full: Damien Chazelle wins best director for 'La La Land' - LA Times

author: Los Angeles Times
title: Damien Chazelle wins best director for 'La La Land' - LA Times
text:
Feb. 26, 2017, 8:42 p.m. Damien Chazelle wins best director for 'La La Land' (Jay L. Clendenin / Los Angeles Times) 
Damien Chazelle won the best director Oscar for his film “La La Land,” a candy-colored musical romance starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone. At 31, Chazelle became the youngest person to win in the director category. 
Last year, his film “Whiplash” was nominated for five Oscars, including best picture. 
In an essay on musicals for The Times, Chazelle wrote, “I wanted to make a movie that would embrace the magic of musicals but root it in the rhythms and texture of real life. I wanted the dances to feel like honest extensions of the characters’ feelings. I wanted to make it seem as though breaking into song were the most natural thing in the world. I wanted to make a movie about how life feels when you're in love and full of dreams in the big city. “ 
The other nominees were:
